snippet: The Chinese search giant Baidu and CloudFlare, a start-up based in San Francisco, have joined in an unusual business arrangement to speed Internet traffic into and out of China.
abstract: Partnership between American start-up CloudFlare and Chinese internet firm Baidu permits websites to load faster across China's forbidding 'Great Firewall' border; virtual joint venture could be hallmark for American tech firms contemplating business in China's tech industry.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese search giant Baidu and CloudFlare, a start-up based in San Francisco, have joined in an unusual business arrangement to speed Internet traffic into and out of China.

headline.main: Baidu and CloudFlare Boost Users Over China’s Great Firewall
headline.print_headline: Partnership Boosts Users Over China’s Great Firewall
